name: Shang
personal background:
<Dr. Gao is a research assistant professor in the Department of Computing at the Hong Kong Polytechnic University. He obtained his Ph.D. degree from the Hong Kong Polytechnic University in 2019, supervised by . He received his M.Eng. degree from Southeast University, China and B.Sc. degree from Hangzhou Dianzi University, China, in 2014 and 2010, respectively. After graduation, he worked in Microsoft China for one year.

Dr. Gao is widely interested in computer security and information security areas. Currently, his research topic is applied cryptography (zero-knowledge proofs).

Dr. Gao has taught the following courses: [COMP5112] fall 21-22 , [COMP5563] fall 22-23 , [COMP5563] fall 23-24 .

Our paper“Leaking Arbitrarily Many Secrets: Any-out-of-Many Proofs and Applications to RingCT Protocols”is accepted byIEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy (S&P’23). Congratulations to Tianyu!

Paper“Detection and Mitigation of DoS Attacks in Software Defined Networks”was accepted byIEEE/ACM Transactions on Networking (ToN) in March 2020.

Paper“Power Adjusting and Bribery Racing: Novel Mining Attacks in the Bitcoin System”was accepted byACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS’19).>
